page.title: List of alumni of Wesley College, Melbourne

revisions.rev:
{{Cleanup|date=March 2010}} [[Image:OWCA Logo.png|right|130px]]
This is a list of notable '''Old Wesley Collegians''', former students of [[Wesley College, Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]].
Alumni of Wesley College are known as Old Collegians and are automatically members of the school's alumni association, the Old Wesley Collegians Association (OWCA), which was founded in 1882.<ref>[http://www.owca.net/about.cfm] OWCA: About Us</ref>
<!-- Please do not add alumni without providing a source and a link to a valid Wikipedia article on that individual --> <!-- Please add alumni in alphabetical order under appropriate category -->
==Academia, scholars, philosophers, clergymen and educators== * Dr [[Andrew Dent]] [[Order of Australia|AC]], Associate Professor of Medicine ([[Melbourne University]]) * Professor [[Brian Lewis (architect)|Brian Lewis]], Dean of the Faculty of Architecture ([[University of Melbourne]])<ref>{{cite journal|last=Crotty|first=Martin|date=June 2001|title=The Limits of Manliness|journal=Australian Humanities Review|url=http://www.australianhumanitiesreview.org/archive/Issue-June-2001/crotty.html#footnote30}}</ref> * Professor [[Carl Wood]] [[Order of Australia|AC]], [[CBE]], [[FRCS]], [[Royal Australian and New Zealand College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists|FRANZCOG]], IVF Pioneer ([[Monash University]]) * Professor [[Chris Silagy]] [[Order of Australia|AO]], Leading pioneer in [[evidence-based medicine]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://menziesfoundation.org.au/annualreports/2001/Pages%20from%20ARpt2001_3-9.pdf|title=Annual Report 2001|publisher=The Sir Robert Menzies Memorial Foundation Limited|pages=7â8|accessdate=15 August 2010}}</ref> * Sir [[David Rivett]] [[KCMG]], Rhodes Scholar and Associate Professor & Professor of Chemistry ([[University of Melbourne]]) * Professor [[Geoffrey Blainey]] [[Order of Australia|AC]], Historian * Professor [[Graham Oppy]], Philosopher ([[Monash University]])<ref>[http://www.infidels.org/library/modern/graham_oppy/oppy-vitae.html The Secular Web: Curriculum Vitae â Graham Oppy]</ref> * Professor [[John Henry Michell]], Mathematician and [[Wrangler (University of Cambridge)|Senior Wrangler]] (Cambridge University) * [[Joseph Lade Pawsey]], Pioneer of the study of Radio Astronomy in Australia * The Hon. Chief Justice [[Michael Black (judge)|Michael Black]] [[Order of Australia|AC]] [[Queen's Counsel|QC]], Barrister, Chief Justice of the Federal Court of Australia, Foundation Chairman of the Victorian Barâs Readers Course, Chair of the Advisory Committee (Juris Doctor Degree at the [[Melbourne Law School]])<ref name="law.anu.edu.au">[http://law.anu.edu.au/CIPL/Conferences&SawerLecture/2009/Program.pdf ANU Law Confernce and Sawer Lecture Program (2009)]</ref><ref name="Biographical Information">[http://www.aija.org.au/conference98/bio.htm Biographical Information]</ref> * [[Laurence Pyke]], [[Rhodes Scholar]], Headmaster of [[Newington College]] * [[Samuel Alexander]] [[Order of Merit|OM]], British Philosopher and the first Jewish fellow of an [[Oxbridge]] College * [[Waleed Aly]], Lecturer at Global Terrorism Research Centre, School of Political & Social Inquiry, and at the [[Monash University Faculty of Arts]] and spokesman for the Islamic Council of Victoria * [[Walter Rosenhain]], Metallurgist * Professor [[Warren Thomson]] [[Order of Australia|OAM]], Music ([[University of Sydney]])<ref name="The Lion: Issue 95">[http://www.wesleycollege.net/resources/issue_95.pdf The Lion: Issue 95]</ref><ref>[http://www.theorderofaustralia.asn.au/quiet_australians/database/extra/extra60.pdf The Order of Australia Database - Warrent Thomson]</ref>
==Business and sports administration== * Alan Oxley, Chairman of the Australian APEC Study Centre ([[Monash University]]), Managing Director of ITS Global, Diplomat representing Australia in Singapore at the [[United Nations]] in New York & Geneva, Australian Ambassador to the General Agreement in Tariffs and Trade and First Australian to serve as GATT Chairman.<ref>[http://www.apec.org.au/docs/050608%20-%20BIO%20NOTE%20-%20Alan%20Oxley.pdf, APEC â Biographys], accessed 25/07/2010 {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref><ref>[http://www.wesleycollege.net/resources/issue_90.pdf Lion Magazine Issue 90]</ref> * Bill Hoffmann [[Order of Australia|AM]], [[Olympic Games]] Administration * [[Daryl Jackson]] [[Order of Australia|AM]], Architect, Chairman of the Australian Film Institute, Trustee ([[National Gallery of Victoria|NGV]]) and Vice President ([[Melbourne Cricket Club|MCC]]). * David Jones [[Officer of the Order of Australia|AO]] [[OBE]] [[KSJ]], President [[Melbourne Cricket Club]], Chairman [[Tattersalls]] * Douglas Oldfield [[Order of Australia|OAM]] [[Institute of Chartered Accountants in Australia|FCA]] [[FCIS]], Accountant and President of the [[Athenaeum Club, Melbourne|Athenaeum Club]] (1992, 1993 & 1994)<ref>[http://www.theorderofaustralia.asn.au/downloads/News240908.pdf The Order of Australia: News]</ref> * [[Eric McCutchan]], Manager of the [[Australian Football League|Victorian Football Dictionary of Biography]</ref> * Jim Barry [[Order of Australia|AM]] [[MBE]], President of Australian Gymnastics for 25 years and [[Olympic Games]] Administration * Sir [[John Grice]], Director of Directors], accessed: 2010-10-03</ref> [[Melbourne Rebels]]<ref>{{cite web | first = Leo | last = Schlink | date= 2010-09-09 | url = and Victorian Rugby Union | work = Australian | publisher = News Limited | accessdate= 2010-10-03}}</ref> and [[Royal Insurance]],<ref>{{ cite press release | date= 2010-09-09 | title = Victorian Director of [[Harris Scarfe Holdings Limited]] (1997â2001) and Chairman of the Royal Australian Holdings Ltd, the Royal Life Insurance Australia Ltd, the State Training Board of Victoria, the Get Chairman of the Australia Audit Bureau of Circulations and Board Member of The Australian Heart Research Institute<ref>[http://www.hri.org.au/media/pdf/2009HRI%20Annual%20Report.pdf The Australian Heart Institute - Annual Report 2009]</ref><ref>[http://au.linkedin.com/pub/steve-hollings/5/285/47a LinkedIn - Steve Hollings]</ref> * [[Wayne Reid]] [[OBE]], President of [[Tennis Australia]]
